Reviews.Title: “Always a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ATrav-El-Holic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip during the week of 2/1/12. The front desk attendance was great - even as I checked in close to 10pm at night! He was courteous and informed me of all that the hotel had to offer (wake up calls, morning breakfast, etc) and also reminded me to have my stay added to my Marriott Rewards account. The rooms here are always nice and clean. (I've stayed here 3 times before but I'm just now writing a review). They are all suites with the perfect size living area, kitchen, bedroom and bath. The two flat-screen TVs allowed me to watch my favorite shows while in any place in the suite. I've never had an issue with anything during any of my stays here. No loud heating system, no uncomfortable beds, no clogged up shower drains - all the stuff that really turns me off about some other hotels I've stayed in. I won't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday stay!”
Reviews.Author: cwaters
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel has an excellent breakfast buffet, with scrambled eggs, meat (sausage or turkey canadian bacon), usually breakfast potatoes and pancakes, fruit, yogurt, waffles, donuts, breads, juices. Probably the best Res Inn breakfast I have seen. Very roomy gathering place, fireplace, pool table near front desk. One night offered a managers reception of chili, soft drinks, beer. Good wifi speed as well. Stayed in a 2 room suite - the 2 room suites have a 4 setting kitchen with an oven (only a cooktop & microwave in the 1 bedroom suites). Workout facility open 24 hours with one eliptical, all purpose workout machine, two treadmills, multiple free weights. Pool & hottub only open Memorial Day to Labor Day (recommend that management enclose this area - would increase winter stays). Location next to White Marsh Mall - many shopping & food options. Easy to get in & out of property. Some problems with efficiency of checkin staff - but overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: brianz09
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night in a one bedroom. Room was spacious and clean. The heater didn't warm up the bedroom as much as the living room so we had to keep the bedroom door open to let the warm air pass freely. Was also a very loud hvac unit. Breakfast was good. Lots of food options closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Best Business/Family Hotel In Area”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best dinner and breakfast buffet of all the Hotels that I stay. Outdoor pool is the only one in the area. Outdoor barbeques, fireplace and hot tub really make it a nice place to hang out at night. Most hotels are winding down on the free amenities these guys never skimp! The manager is always around and the staff remembers who you are. They also have the shuttle that takes you over to all the restaurants in the area and picks you up. I have stayed at this property many times and have never been disappointed. Just a great place and make you feel welcome every time.

Reviews.Title: “No Wireless Internet”
Reviews.Author: pikapp8
Reviews.Content: As a platinum member of Marriott, I come to expect certain basic things when checking into a hotel, wireless internet in the rooms being one of them. This hotel is conveniently located off I-95 north of Baltimore and is within a block of many chain restaurants and shopping. There's a Bally Total Fitness nearby which is a big plus for me. The hotel has the standard Residence Inn amenities; free breakfast, manager's reception Monday-Wednesday and free laundry (a pleasant surprise). I paid $165 per night mid week which was relatively high but I was on company travel so I really didn't care. My biggest gripe is the fact that there is no wireless internet in the rooms. What hotel in this day and age has no wireless internet? As a frequent user of my iPad, I prefer wireless over LAN and this was a big inconvenience. I felt like going to Best Buy and purchasing a $50 router for them as a courtesy. The staff were generally friendly and the rooms were the usual oversized suites that one comes to expect from the Residence Inn brand.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice!”
Reviews.Author: TMEmobile
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn White Marsh while in town for Baltimore Grand Prix. While the air conditioner was very loud, the rest of the hotel was surprisingly nice. The outdoor pool area with fireplace, basketball court, and game area were well kept. The breakfast was one of the best free buffets outside of an Embassy Suites. Our room was a nice two room suite with newer furniture and Josh, the Front Desk Guy, was super helpful in fixing a room issue. For whatever issues the hotel had previously, it appears to be well run now. Enjoy your stay, you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: karen47906
Reviews.Content: This is my goto place whenever I'm in town visiting family. The rooms are very clean and a good size and updated. The staff are friendly and helpful. They have the best breakfast buffet of any hotel I've ever stayed. It is well located in the White Marsh area - close to shopping and restaurants but tucked back from the main road and therefore very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “So far, so good! Will be here a few more days.”
Reviews.Author: Dan9x
Reviews.Content: We are a group of parents staying here while our boys are playing a baseball tourney at Ripken. The staff have been great, the hotel is kept neat and clean. They offer a fantastic hot breakfast in the morning and on Monday - Wednesday a hot dinner with comp beer & wine. The rooms are spacious and have fully equipped kitchens. The only issues that have come up so far, the mattress' are very firm, some find that difficult to adjust to. The AC blower unit is in the bedroom. It is noisy and everytime it starts ti can wake even the heavist of sleepers. They have a nice business area, a grill for use outside, a nice sitting area outside with a fireplace and an outdoor pool. There is a lifeguard there during the day. We are enjoying our stay so far and will be here for a few more days. I will update at the end of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Spotless and Well Managed”
Reviews.Author: Often_on_road
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for its location off of I-95, easy access to I-695 and travel times to locations in and around Baltimore. I also needed a one-bedroom with a door, a handicapped accessible bathroom for a family member and a kitchen. Throw in a very good breakfast buffet, manager's reception and excellent TripAdvisor ratings, and I booked. The value was good but not exceptional. I was not disappointed. The front desk was exceptionally friendly. The hotel was spotless -- far better than some of the luxury hotels that I have stayed in. Breakfast was more than adequate. The room was very good, though noise from the frig and HVAC sometimes woke me up. Two flat screens, good amenities, good water pressure and a nice kitchen. One item that could be improved -- there was no luggage rack in the room. Parking is free and plentiful. In contrast, when I stayed at a hotel in Baltimore, they charged $20+ nightly plus a fee every time you entered/exited the parking garage. This is a hotel that we will definitely use again when traveling to the area. Family members who visited us at the hotel were similarly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: oceans61
Reviews.Content: Came with my husband for his work. Brought our small dog with. The hotel is located very close to 4 different shopping areas and many restaurants. It looks simple on the outside-though well landscaped. They were even working on the landscaping in January. Inside the lobby is impressive with a fire constantly going. Very welcoming. The staff are very friendly. We had a one bedroom suite which was decorated very well- bright blue and yellow.Everything is new and very clean. Full kitchen and eating area, sleeper couch, chair, desk, TV in living room and bedroom, separate sink area from stool and tub room, bedroom closet and coat closet. The hotel provides a hot, full breakfast each morning. M-W they have a dinner as well. There is a pool table, outdoor gas fire to sit around, workout room, free laundry. I wish we were here in the summer to enjoy the outdoor pool, spa, sport court and grills. They also have a free Trolley that takes you to the shopping malls. It only runs from 4:00 PM to 10:00 PM though. The only way it could be better is if the pool and spa were indoors! I wish there was more areas to walk the dog close by. There was enough sidewalks for about a 15 minute walk-then it was busy roads.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Business Meeting”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie029
Reviews.Content: We recently held a 2 day conference in the Residence Inn's meeting room and it couldn't have gone more smoothly. The impeccable service began from the very first email to obtain information on the hotel until the very end when we signed off on the bill. I was told the conference room typically held approximately 35-40 people, but our meeting had 55 attendees. The staff arranged the room so that everyone had a seat at a table (classroom style) with a comfortable amount of space around them. We were able to bring in outside catering for a minimal fee and were able to use the breakfast area as a serving/seating area for the lunch break. The staff was incredible in providing help to set-up the outside catering as well as accessories and utensils to make the set-up more appealing. Above all, the Residence Inn White Marsh was the most afforable hotel in the area to host our meeting. With its outstanding customer service and clean, like-new facilities,we will definitely be utilizing this center for future conferences. Thanks to Erica and her team for a helping us host a flawless event!

Reviews.Title: “As Close To Home As A Hotel Can Be”
Reviews.Author: Maruru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for nearly 3 months earlier this year due to my job. I cannot say enough great things about it - in fact, after a while I started accidentally referring to the place as "home"! The staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. Marula was a real sweetheart, and all front desk personnel were very helpful in addressing whatever questions I posed. Housekeeping was great - they even loaded/unloaded my dishwasher a few times which was unexpected (but nice!). Initially I booked a 1-Bedroom suite, but having seen the Studio, I decided to switch because the Studio had a much more open feel and the 1-Bedroom actually felt smaller since the only real difference between the two rooms, in my opinion, was the addition of a wall to separate the sleeping area from the living room. The Studio also had a breakfast bar area whereas the 1-Bedroom setup had a small dining table instead. Both rooms included a fold-out couch which could accommodate 2 additional guests. In both rooms the amenities included: a dishwasher, full size fridge, sink with disposal, kitchen stocked with plates, bowls, cups, silverware, cooking utensils, pots, pans, dish detergent, and coffee maker. The bathroom area provided a hair dryer as well as shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soaps. Additional toiletries were availble from the front desk. Some of my favorite perks were: free laundry (your room comes with a laundry basket and there were 4 washers and 8 dryers available down by the gym; detergent and fabric softener sheets were free at the front desk); free breakfast (fruits, cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurts, coffee, tea, juices, etc.); complimentary grocery shopping (you give them a list of what you need and they'll buy it for you - you pay for the groceries but the service is free); happy hour on Mondays - Thursdays (free beer and wine, and usually some sort of food such as hot wings, pasta dishes, or burgers); and a trolley service on demand that will bring you to local places such as the mall, the bus park & ride, and The Avenue (an outdoor mall with several restaurants and bars). Yes, the trolley service was free too but don't forget to tip! The location is also great. You have plenty of dining options within a short walk or drive from the hotel (your typical chain restaurants), plus a grocery store, a regular mall, an outdoor mall, and IKEA (OK most people don't usually buy furniture while they're on vacation but they hey also serve food there!). If you're in town during baseball season, why not check out an Orioles game? You can walk over or take the trolley to the bus park & ride on the other side of Honeygo Blvd. - behind Ikea - and for $20 round trip per adult (children are probably cheaper), you can hop on a bus to Camden Yards. It's about a 30 minute ride and you don't need to deal with the hassle of driving, parking, and paying the tunnel toll. They drop you off right at the gate and pick you up there after the game. Camden Yards is a beautiful, modern park and the games hardly ever sell out so tickets are usually available for as little as $12. My stay at this hotel was an enjoyable one, and the surrounding area provided everything I needed to enjoy my temporary home. If I ever find myself back in the Baltimore area for business or pleasure, I will most certainly stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hfGJMJpfu7
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! I am going back next week. Spacious rooms. The room I stayed in (130) had a small kitchenette. In other words, sink, microwave, refrigerator, Dish Washer, Garbage disposal etc...Nice weight room with cold water. Free Laundry Room with detergent and dryer sheets provided at the front desk. Hot Breakfast also with usual Continental amenities from 6:30-9:30am includes eggs. Managers Special in evenings includes plentiful buffet style eating-no additional cost. Free Internet access in rooms via an Ethernet cable. I could not think of anything I needed. Shopping Mall within 1/4 mile. Decent Restaurants in the area. I could go on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: Autumngirl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel on the northeast side of Baltimore, choose the Residence Inn Baltimore White Marsh. This is the friendliest and cleanest hotel we have stayed in in quite a long time. We were in Baltimore to spend the Easter weekend with our daughter who resides in NE Baltimore, and she recommended the Residence Inn because of the safe area it is in. She had us cancel the booking we blindly made at the La Quinta just off of the I-95 exit there as she felt that area was too unsafe. She was spot on for the Residence's location which is on a side street adjacent to the White Marsh Mall area and good restaurants. Each hotel staff member greeted us coming and going with the most pleasant attitude! Our 1st floor room was a one bedroom suite and the living room/kitchen area was nice to host our daughter in as we came and went. Our room was incredibly quiet. Everything was in great working order and super clean. We also enjoyed their fully equipped gym and yes, they even had towels on hand in there. The full hot breakfast buffet was lacking nothing and everything was delicious. The lobby area has a gas fireplace and the fire was going, adjacent to it was the library/internet area with a large flat screen TV, and just off of that was a billiard room. Families were seen playing pool and basketball outside, and everyone appeared to also be enjoying their stay. This will be our regular NE Baltimore hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel and sevice not recomended for familes”
Reviews.Author: almsafer_79
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel. The hotel location is nice but the service and cleaning at the hotel is extremely awful. The front desk personals are nice the GM was terrible lady. I would not recommend staying at this hotel at all. Save your money and find other residence INN hotel in that area. Totally not recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: classicpooh2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite, and it was clean, staff was friendly, breakfast was great, and location was excellent. Close to shopping, dining, and downtown visiting just 15 minutes away. The few things I had issues with were: no stove in the kitchen (just two burners and a microwave), and I had to buy some cleaner for the shower because it just did not seem clean. There are 4 washer and 8 dryers on the first floor and the hotel provides detergent and fabric softner. They only have an outdoor pool, but for this trip it was not that big a deal for us. All in all, this hotel was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: OCsandy
Reviews.Content: This property always comes through with the degree of excellence that you always expect from a Residence Inn. So the only way to really grade one location from another is to rate the service and staff. I'm happy to say that the front desk staff - including a trainee - went far beyond what they needed to do to accommodate a request I had about room location. It made my 2-day, weekend stay, very enjoyable. For anyone planning on staying here: This property is very peaceful and quiet. But, if you want to, you can experience the pandemonium of a couple of huge shopping areas that are just minutes away. It's a great location. TIP: Smoker? Ask for rooms in the 101 thru 104 range. There's easy access to an outside area from these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: Slugnet
Reviews.Content: My husband stays here a lot on business. He prefers it to the Hilton because its more homely. I came with him on this trip from the UK. Rooms are large studios or suites. They have kitchenettes, complimentary breakfast and a simple, complimentary evening meal Mon - Thu. The area feels safe, there are shops and restaurants nearby in the town centre. We use the car but you could probably walk there in about 15 mins. There is a Mall nearby as well. There is a trolley to the Mall from the hotel, by request. It's about a 25 minute drive to the inner harbour, out of rush hour. It's a clean, comfortable, friendly hotel. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: OKAYJOE1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, clean, conveniently located near a large mall, restaurants, etc. Lots of space, kitchen, full size refrigerator, microwave, etc. You will feel like you are in a small apartment rather than a hotel room. The staff is professional and courteous. There is a small but ample fitness room with a universal machine and cardio equipment. You can even do your own laundry onsite in several washers/dryers with TV in the laundry room to boot. The only real negative I could find was that the room HVAC fan is way too loud (just like the bathroom fan). You will most certainly awake whenever the the HVAC fan kicks on, however you have your own thermostat so you could just shut the thing if you must get some rest....come on Marriot, this must be fixed as this is a new hotel. One last thing, the hotel is "smoke free"....fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay again”
Reviews.Author: State of Mainer
Reviews.Content: We had our second stay at this hotel this past weekend when we went to visit our college daughter. We stayed two nights in a one-bedroom suite which has a full kitchen, pull-out couch and dining area in one room and a comfortable queen bedroom and bath in the other. They provide a full and tasty breakfast every morning and a sort of happy hour/light meal weeknights. The service is very friendly, the property is clean, and the location is good- down the street from a large mall, Ikea, MANY chain restaurants, and a grocery store. It's located just off I-95 north of Baltimore City but it takes us about 20 minutes to drive to downtown Baltimore via 695W and the Jones Falls Expressway. We paid $129 a night booking through Marriott.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Baltimore White Marsh
HotelInfo.Address: 4980 Mercantile Rd, Baltimore, MD 21236
